author: Plato
quote: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.

author: Aristotle
quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.

author: Socrates
quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: that word is love.

author: Confucius
quote: Can there be a love which does not make demands on its object?

author: Epicurus
quote: It is not so much our friends’ help that helps us as the confident knowledge that they will help us.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: In love, one and one are one.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: Love is not a state; it is a verb, an action.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love.

author: Seneca
quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.

author: Rumi
quote: Lovers don’t finally meet somewhere. They’re in each other all along.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.

author: David Hume
quote: To love is to feel pleasure in the happiness of another.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: Love is the only thing that makes the happiness of another essential to your own.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Compassion is the basis of morality, and love its greatest expression.

author: Baruch Spinoza
quote: He who loves God cannot strive that God should love him in return.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love, and you shall be loved.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.

author: Voltaire
quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Where there is love there is life.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.

author: Henri Bergson
quote: Love may be or it may not; it must be free.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
quote: To love another in spite of his weaknesses is to love as God loves.

author: John Stuart Mill
quote: Genuine justice blends love with respect for individuality.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: The things that we love tell us what we are.

author: Michel de Montaigne
quote: If I am pressed to say why I loved him, I can say no more than because he was he, and I was I.

author: Diogenes
quote: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.

author: Heraclitus
quote: Love is a child that is never weary of play.

author: Pythagoras
quote: Friendship is one soul dwelling in two bodies; love is the harmony of the soul.

author: Cicero
quote: Love is the crowning grace of humanity.

author: Boethius
quote: Love binds people more strongly than fear or force.

author: Seneca
quote: To love is to value someone else’s life as highly as your own.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The only reward of virtue is virtue; the only way to have a friend is to be one, and the only way to be loved is to love.

author: Plato
quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the gods.

author: Aristotle
quote: To love someone is to will the good of that person.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.

author: Epicurus
quote: Of all the things that wisdom provides to help one live one’s entire life in happiness, the greatest by far is the possession of friendship.

author: Socrates
quote: The hottest love has the coldest end.
